column9: At the initial start it causes sneezing and blowing of nose, and the must to clear heavy drainage from throat and nose. After that it is easier to breath.

column2: lpuga, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In march startd with dry cough..then severe phlegm now throat problems like lump or hair in throat.. cough and phlegm subsided but still having throat problem have never had this problem before went to several doctors all said allergies. Went to specialist (ENT) and he gave me samples of Astepro and Zyrtec to take at night. I used last night and felt sweet drainage run down my throat then felt stuffy nose develop and felt a tightness in chest hard to breathe..and woke up with it this morning.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: trk, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Every fall for the last several years, I have been so sick. Horrible headaches, post nasal drip and congestion. Allergies started in July/August and by September/October, I had to take very strong antibiotics and prednisone. Sometimes more than one round. This product is a life saver. I have been on it a few weeks and felt measurably better almost immediately. I hope this keeps up. If it does, it will be the first fall I have felt well in several years. The only product that was effective and I have tried most on the market.(If you follow the instructions, you will not get the bad taste.)

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

I didn't feel this way yesterday...I'm not taking this medication again.

column2: js, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This product does help alleviate my allergies a little.  The problem is that I was one of the lucky ones to have the side effect.  The taste was bitter, but that wasn't the worst of it.  It started to affect my taste buds a few weeks later.  Then for 2 weeks I couldn't eat anything because everything, and I mean everything, tasted horrible and  intensified the bitter taste like I drank a gallon of liquid soap.  I almost thought that someone was trying to poison me.  I couldn't figure out the cause but then I found out that this was a side effect.  I have year round allergies and sometimes get migraines.  I am affected by my allergies and an especially allergic to cats, ash tree and dust mites, but I would rather suffer from my symptoms then deal with the side effect again.  If you are lucky not to experience this side effect, then it might be a good product.

column9: I am 56 years old and have previously never suffered from any type of nasal issues. Recently however I bagan having a problem with nasal drip, more of an annoyance. Not yet available as a generic, so the pharmaceutical company that developed it will "Take us to the cleaners" until their patent expires.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: digi, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I didn't have any of the problems with the taste, and it seemed to be helping shortly after I first used it.  But after about 5-10 minutes, I started getting a burning sensation in my nostrils and sinuses, and then a few minutes after that a sneezing fit started which lasted about 5 minutes, then about 5 minutes of serious dripping and running.  Now, 20 minutes later, my nose remains completely blocked, much worse than before I took the medication.  I've never had an allergic reaction to any drug (except neosporin) before, but possibly I'm allergic to one of the inactive ingredients??  Anyway, clearly not a success.  Also, I *love* the directions:  step 1 -- clear your nose.  If I could clear my nose, I wouldn't need the doggone stuff!

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: Dawn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've suffered for years from continuous post nasal symptoms. Nasal irrigation keeps sneezing and itch from seasonal allergies well under control but doesn't eliminate the post nasal. Allergist gave me Astepro sample and I only take one dose in each nostril at night. The taste if any goes down my throat is sweet and doesn't last so it doesn't bother me at all. I don't notice drowsiness during the day by omitting a day time dose. It seems to be helping after a week but hasn't eliminated all the symptoms yet. I'm sticking with it since it's so easy to take and hasn't caused me any of the side effects others describe.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: ....., 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: There had been some improvement with the stuffiness before I go to bed. I still wake up at night because it' hard to breathe. I still have a hard time staying asleep due to the stuffiness.

column2: Sleepy But Better, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Because of the recent dry weather in my state, I've had unseasonal allergies. I was perscribed this medicine. It works fine.But, I'm finding that it makes me really, really sleepy. At first, it didn't. Actually, it was the opposite. I stayed up a lot. But, I went about 2 weeks from the initial first 3 doses(that were a day each), and found myself really sleepy. I slept for 15 hours. Then I woke up and for a week I was fine, but started having some symptoms agian. So I took another dose, and I slept for 2 days straight. And I didn't know it, until i woke up and my husband told me. He was about to take me to the hospital. For the next week afterward, it was in my urine really strong. (it wasn't before)I've gone to different places to check and see if anyone else had this as a side-effect, and found none. I've talked to my doctor, and he was surprised it did that to me. I'm writing this so that maybe there is someone else who have had this happen to them while taking this medication. If you start to feel better, then quit. Go back to the doctor, because maybe you don't need the medicine. And no, I don't drink or smoke and I only sprayed it once in both nostrals.Here's my word of caution: It's a good drug. But be very very careful if you become drowsey, and start sleeping alot. No drug should do a person like that. If you notice you're sleeping more than normal, consult your doctor before going any further. Abnormal sleep (more or less) can lead to further health issues. Other than the sleeping, the medicine has worked like a charm! I'd recommend it to my family and friends (however, including a small warning).

column2: LaLaRN, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Dr gave me samples to help with my constant headaches after CT scan showed thickening of my sinus cavaity. If I use it at night before going to bed, I don't wake up with a headache. If I take in the AM instead, I have a headache all day long. Also if I take at night, the bitter taste is gone in the AM. However, It makes my eyes sensative to fluorescent lights and I have problems with Dizziness. I'm very sleepy in the AM, no matter how much sleep I get. Has made me late for work a few days already. I haven't weighted myself in a while, but I'm afraid it has made me gain a few pounds. These side effects are much easier to deal with than the side effects of allegra  & singular which gave me extreme dizziness and intensified my headaches as well as causing my heart to race. I'm still not convinced this is the best course of treatment. I've never had allergies in my life. Based on CT scan, I think this is more of a deep sinus infection instead of allergies.

I had the same reaction.  Odd, but I have never had any experience like this.  ALmost to the point I think maybe it was allergic reaction?  Horrible stuff!  Be careful!

column2: Fuyuko, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor gave me a sample of this because I have trouble taking oral antihistamines. It felt like I'd drunk a triple cappucino from Starbucks. I tried everything. Halved the dose. Spit out the stuff that ran down my throate etc. Unfortunately, in no way was this toleratble. Also, some people can't eat sorbitol. Its a known laxative and stomach upsetter. I'm not sure why the manufacturer felt sweet snot would taste good. It does not. I'd rather have unflavored stuff that doesn't upset my stomach. I'm disappointed.

column2: Marie in DC, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor gave me a sample of Astepro as well as a prescription, because Nasacort and Astelin that I had been using made me wake up with thick mucus in my throat.  Astepro worked great the first night, but when I used it again in the morning, it made my nose run all day long.  I tried again the next evening.  It works at night, but during the day, I sneeze, my eyes run and I have to blow my nose every 5 minutes. Too bad, because it did loosen the mucus and my throat felt much better in the morning.  I am calling my doctor to get something else.
